question.title: Starting an intent when app is in background
question.body:
I am creating an alarm application; I have tested everything:

  • Exact alarm
  • Forground Service
  • Disabling battery optimization
  • Full-screen intenet notification ...

these are permissions I have used:

<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM" />
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.USE_EXACT_ALARM" />
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WAKE_LOCK" />
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.USE_FULL_SCREEN_INTENT" />
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW" />
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.DISABLE_KEYGUARD" />
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.VIBRATE" />
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED" />

The alarm works when the phone is locked or even asleep, but only if my app is in the foreground; the moment my app goes to the background, the alarm doesn't work.

My research shows that, after Android 14, there are many restrictions for apps in the background. I am wondering if, after this time, no alarm apps could be written?

Is there any workaround? Why is Google doing this?

answers.body:
I am wondering if, after this time, no alarm apps could be written?

Alarm apps can still be made and alarms still work (as long as you have the correct permissions) its just starting a service or activity from the background that does not. If you are indeed trying to make an alarm app then you can use a high priority notification in exchange of a full screen intent

question_comments.body: @MarkusKauppinen I have tried them all but they fail when app is in background
Are you trying with setExactAndAllowWhileIdle() or setAlarmClock() or some other way?

79710509.body: thanks a lot. I had visioned an alarm exactly like the one that is shown when a clock alarm sets off, but I had finally come to the exact conclusion that you suggested. you said alarm can work, but my app will almost always be in the background when an alarm needs to go off (for example, you don't need to have the clock as the foreground app to show an alarm). if you can share an example (not for the notification but for the alarm), I'd be very happy.
